message: @jamespaxi Which flight are you on? Given the lack of flights from London, there's always a chance we'll be on the same one.
Ah, no, I'm Heathrow, BA, on the 10th. Everything possible there is different...
hi chaps! I have booked everything and will be arriving alone from the other side of the ocean, London! Will be quite the adventure and it would be great to meetup with a few of you guys. :)
@andrewgodwin Gatwick KLM on the 9th! :)
When it says Peachtree Center station is closest, how close? Since coming from OS will be dragging around a big bag plus lugging my laptop in backpack.

You should be able to take the local train - MRTA - then by all means, come by the registration desk, help stuff bags for a while.  Bound to be flocks of people, and there are interesting places within walking distance, so you're bound to find a group heading out somewhere!
Don't even have to go outside, there is a skybridge and everything
... stairs => steps...
@varkot thanks! Was confused by "help stuff bags", but I think I found out what you mean. http://us.pycon.org/2011/volunteer/onsite/ I guess helping out is a good way to meet a few peeps. :)
http://us.pycon.org/2011/venue/directions/
@GrahamDumpleton The hotel is directly connected to the mall (and the station is inside the mall)
...so think in terms of walking across a food court, and a skybridge (length of crossing the street).    I think there are 3 or 4 stairs at the skybridge; honestly don't remember from the train.
I think I took the outside walk from the train without knowing about the inside method. Took like 5 minutes.
@yarkot: the information is useful for me.  I am also arriving alone oversea.  Actually, it is my first time to US.  Everything is strange for me.
@ThinkerYzu Wear a shirt with a Python logo on it if possible (http://www.cafepress.com/pydotorg) and I'm sure you will find others headed for the hotel
@coderanger If its cold I don't think I will be wearing just a T-Shirt. Just spent a month in the tropics. I hate the cold.
Make sure you visit the WearPython stand and get a fleece or something more substantial while you are here!
@andrewgodwin what time is your flight? Mine is leaving LHR at 2pm
@brutasse Same here - BA0227, on march 10th. They only do one to ATL a day, I believe.
is it colder than London? Can't be! :)
For the next 5 days or so, the highs are supposed to be in the upper 50s, with not too much sun. This is actually colder than it has been for a while. The trees are in full blossom right now.
Here's the 10-day forecast from weather.com for the area around the hotel: http://www.weather.com/weather/tenday/30303
@andrewgodwin @brutasse I'll also be on BA0227, march 10th - sadly without Python t-shirt or fleece...
@haard we need a sign or someting :). Maybe pictures, @andrewgodwin can be recognized easily
I'll arrive on march 10th from Nicaragua, any latin americans attending? see you there!
Bear in mind I'm not always in front of a red background. That can catch people off-guard.
@brutasse @haard I'll make sure to wear one of my many, many Python, Django or ep.io tshirts. And look relatively dorky.
Bring a red sign =) I'll be looking... like a bearded Swede, I suppose?
Anyone flying to PyCon from London Heathrow 14:00 on the 8th? I'm on the delta flight but there is a BA flight at the same time which @tartley will be on...
Anyone flying in from SF thursday 8:40am? :)
